section.title:
costing for summarized BOMs
bills of materials costed summarized view of Costed Summarized BOM
section.para: A summarized bill of materials (BOMs) shows all the material requirements for an item. The components for subassemblies are included in this view; however, the top-level subassemblies themselves are excluded. To view a costed summarized BOM, select the Costed Summarized BOM option. The following screen will appear:
When displaying a costed summarized BOMs, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Enter the item number of the manufactured item you would like to view a costed summarized BOMs for.

If revision control is enabled at your site, specify the BOMs revision number you want to view. If none exists, simply enter a value to create one. The status of the revision will also be displayed. The following statuses apply to revisions:

This is the current, default revision used for costing and material requirements planning (MRP). Only one revision can be active at the same time. Active revisions may be modified. However, once a revision becomes inactive, it may no longer be changed.
Select to cause expired components to be listed in the Bill of Materials display.

Select a number using the arrows, or manually enter a value up to a maximum of 999. Components that have been expired from the BOMs within the specified number of days will be included in the display.
Select to cause future components to be listed in the Bill of Materials display.

Select a number using the arrows, or manually enter a value up to a maximum of 999. Components that will be added in future to the BOMs within the specified number of days will be included in the display.
Select to display standard costs for the specified item.

tip.para: When labor and overhead are posted to the general ledger, they are posted using their actual cost. This is a departure from the rule which governs materialsâ€”namely, that materials are always posted using their standard cost. Differences between actual and standard labor and overhead costs will be reflected in inventory cost variances when work order production or operations are posted. You can address these variances if and when they occur by posting your actual costs to standard.

listitem.para: Select to display actual costs for the specified item.
Display lists summarized BOMs components, using the specified parameters.
